Sense.DEF: the tenth letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第十个字母
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= joule or joules 焦耳

Sense.DEF: to push something into or towards something else with short quick movements

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She jabbed at the elevator buttons.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她猛地按下电梯按钮。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: When I didn’t respond, he jabbed a finger at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有回应﹐他就用手指捅了我一下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stop jabbing me with your elbow!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别用胳膊肘捅我！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The soldier jabbed a rifle into his ribs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个士兵用步枪戳他的肋骨。

Sense.DEF: a sudden hard hit, especially with a pointed object or your fistclosed hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boxer with a good left jab
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能打出漂亮左刺拳的拳击手

Sense.DEF: something you say to criticize someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: White House officials took a sharp jab at the Democrats’ plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白宫官员对民主党的计划作出尖锐的批评。

Sense.DEF: an injection given to prevent you from catching a disease
Sense.EXAMPLE: a typhoid jab
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤寒预防针

Sense.DEF: to talk quickly in an excited and unclear way – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 急促［激动］而含糊地说(话)〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tourists were jabbering away on the bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些游客在公共汽车上叽叽呱呱地说话。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used to lift a heavy weight off the ground, such as a car, and support it while it is in the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hydraulic jack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 液压千斤顶

Sense.DEF: a card used in card games that has a man’s picture on it and is worth less than a queen and more than a ten
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of jacks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对杰克

Sense.DEF: an electronic connection for a telephone or other electric machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a phone jack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话插座

Subsense.DEF: a children’s game in which the players try to pick up small objects called jacks while bouncing and catching a ball
a small metal or plastic object that has six points, used in this game
Subsense.TRAN: 〔抛接子游戏中用的〕带有六个尖端的金属[塑料]小物件

Sense.DEF: a small whiteball at which players aim larger balls in the game of bowls
a rude expression meaning anything at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t know jack shit about cars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对汽车一窍不通。

Sense.DEF: to waste someone’s time by deliberately making things difficult for them
Sense.TRAN: 故意刁难〔某人〕以浪费其时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop jacking me around and make up your mind!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别浪费我的时间了﹐拿定主意吧！

Sense.DEF: to stop doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d love to jack in my job and go and live in the Bahamas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很想辞掉工作﹐去巴哈马居住。

Sense.DEF: to masturbate
to lift something heavy off the ground using a jack
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack the car up higher – I can’t get the tire off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把车再顶高些﹐轮胎卸不下来。

Sense.DEF: to increase prices, sales etc by a large amount
Sense.TRAN: 大幅度提高〔价格﹑销量等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re just interested in jacking up their profit margins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们只对大幅增加利润感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: a wild animal like a dog that lives in Asia and Africa and eats the remaining parts of dead animals
Sense.TRAN: 豺﹐胡狼〔生活在亚洲和非洲〕

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for an annoying stupid person
a boot worn by soldiers that covers their leg up to the knee
a black bird like a crow that sometimes steals small bright objects
a short light coat

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a suede jacket
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 绒面革夹克

Sense.DEF: the part of a suit that covers the top part of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gene has to wear a jacket and tie to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉恩上班得穿西装打领带。
Sense.EXAMPLE: tweed jackets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗花呢西装上衣

Sense.DEF: a stiff piece of folded paper that fits over the cover of a book to protect it
a stiff paper cover that protects a record
a cover that surrounds and protects some types of machines
a potato baked with its skin on
a way of describing frost as a person – used especially when talking to children
Sense.TRAN: 霜〔拟人化称呼﹐尤用于与儿童说话时〕

Sense.DEF: a large powerful tool used to break hard materials such as the surface of a road
a children’s toy shaped like a box, with a figure inside that springs out when the box is opened
Sense.TRAN: 玩偶匣〔内装小人﹐匣盖开启时小人即跳出〕

Sense.DEF: a knife with a blade that folds into its handle
a dive in which you bend at the waist when you are in the air
if a large vehicle with two parts jack-knifes, it slides out of control and the back part swings towards the front part
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truck skidded on the ice and jack-knifed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆铰接卡车在冰面上打滑后发生了弯折。

Sense.DEF: someone who can do many different types of work, but who often is not very skilled at any of them
a pumpkin1 that has a face cut into it and a candle put inside to shine through the holes
Sense.TRAN: 南瓜灯笼〔把南瓜内部挖空﹐表面雕出人面形状﹐内点蜡烛〕

Sense.DEF: a large amount of money that you can win in a game that is decided by chance
Sense.TRAN: 〔碰运气游戏中的〕头奖﹐最高奖
Sense.EXAMPLE: a £50,000 jackpot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五万英镑的头奖
Sense.EXAMPLE: jackpot winners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头奖得主

Sense.DEF: a large North American hareanimal like a large rabbit with very long ears

Sense.LEXUNIT: before you can say Jack Robinson
Sense.DEF: very quickly or suddenly
a young man who enjoys drinking alcohol and going out with his male friends, and who thinks he is sexually attractive
Sense.TRAN: 〔爱喝酒﹑常与男性伙伴外出﹑自以为很有性魅力的〕浪荡青年男子

Sense.DEF: belonging to or typical of the period between 1603 and 1625 in Britain, when James I was king of England
Sense.TRAN: 英王詹姆斯一世时期的﹔具有詹姆斯一世时期风格的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jacobean drama
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯一世时代的戏剧

Sense.DEF: someone in the 17th or 18th centuries who supported King James II of England and wanted one of his descendants to rule England
Sense.TRAN: 〔17 或 18 世纪〕英王詹姆斯二世的追随者﹐拥护詹姆斯二世及其后裔统治英国的人

Sense.DEF: a large indoor bath that makes hot water move in strong currents around your body
Sense.TRAN: 极可意涡流式浴缸﹐按摩浴缸

Sense.DEF: a hard, usually green stone often used to make jewellery
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jade necklace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翡翠项链

Sense.DEF: the light green colour of jade
someone who is jaded is no longer interested in or excited by something, usually because they have experienced too much of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concert should satisfy even the most jaded critic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场音乐会应该能让最不易打动的评论家都觉得满意。

Sense.DEF: a short period of time when you suddenly cry etc without controlling how much you do it
Sense.TRAN: 〔不加控制的〕一阵大哭/狂买/喋喋不休等

Sense.DEF: having a rough or pointed edge or surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: the broken bottle’s jagged edge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碎瓶子的锯齿状边缘
Sense.EXAMPLE: the jagged rocks of St. Saviour’s Point
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣基督角嶙峋的岩石

Sense.DEF: a large South American wild cat with brown and yellow fur with black spots
a place where criminals are kept as part of their punishment, or where people who have been charged with a crime are kept before they are judged in a law court
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been in jail for three months already.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经入狱三个月。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They’re going to jail for a long time.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将长期坐牢。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The judge sent Meyer to jail for six years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官判迈耶六年监禁。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government would put him in jail if he stayed in the country.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他留在国内﹐政府就会把他关进监狱。

Collocate.COLLOC: spend time/three months/six years etc in jail
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 坐牢/在监狱里被关三个月/六年等

Collocate.COLLOC: serve time/five years etc in jail

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The suspects were taken to the local jail.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 嫌犯被送入当地监狱。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 高度戒备/最高戒备的监狱

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s serving a 7-year jail sentence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在服七年的刑期。

Sense.DEF: to put someone in jail

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Watson was jailed for tax evasion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃森因逃税入狱。

GramExa.PROPFORM: jail sb for two months/six years/life etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They ought to jail her killer for life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们应判杀她的凶手终身监禁。

Sense.DEF: someone who is legally too young to have sex with
Sense.TRAN: 祸水妞[郎]〔指与之发生性关系即构成犯罪的未成年者〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has spent a lot of time in prison
an escape or an attempt to escape from prison, especially by several people
someone who is in charge of guarding a prison or prisoners
a building that has a jail in it
a small, very hot green pepper used especially in Mexican food
Sense.TRAN: 墨西哥小青椒〔极辣﹐尤用于墨西哥食物〕

Sense.DEF: a very old car in bad condition
a thick sweet substance made from boiled fruit and sugar, eaten especially on bread
Sense.EXAMPLE: strawberry jam
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草莓酱
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jam sandwich
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 果酱三明治
Sense.EXAMPLE: jam jars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 果酱罐

Sense.DEF: a situation in which it is difficult or impossible to move because there are so many cars or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry we’re late. We got stuck in a traffic jam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我们来晚了﹐路上堵车。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a machine does not work because something is stopping a part from moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: It caused a jam in the printer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这导致打印机卡纸。

Sense.DEF: a difficult situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We became friends after he helped me out of a jam.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他帮助我摆脱过一次困境﹐之后我们就成了朋友。

Subsense.DEF: a jam session
Subsense.TRAN: 爵士乐[摇滚乐]即兴演奏会

Subsense.DEF: a song or piece of music, especially one by a rap or rock group
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指说唱音乐或摇滚乐的〕一首歌曲﹐一首乐曲

Sense.DEF: to play rock music loudly and with a lot of energy or emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make no mistake – these guys know how to kick out the jams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 错不了﹐这些家伙知道如何激情地演奏摇滚乐。

Sense.DEF: good things someone promises you, which never happen
Sense.TRAN: 空头许诺﹐许而不予的好东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is an element of ‘jam tomorrow’ about some of the government’s policies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的有些政策有一点空头支票的味道。

Sense.DEF: to push something somewhere using a lot of force, until it can move no further
Sense.EXAMPLE: He jammed his foot on the accelerator and the car sped off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他使劲踩下油门﹐汽车飞驰而去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A chair had been jammed up against the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门被一把椅子牢牢顶住了。

Sense.DEF: if a moving part of something jams, or if you jam it, it no longer works properly because something is preventing it from moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: The front roller has jammed on the photocopier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复印机的前滚筒卡住了。

Sense.DEF: if a lot of people or vehicles jam a place, they fill it so that it is difficult to move
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crowds jammed the entrance to the stadium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育场入口处挤满了人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They all jammed into the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们全都挤进了车里。

Sense.DEF: to play music in an informal way with other people
to slow down a car suddenly by putting your foot down hard on the brake
if telephone calls jam the switchboard of an organization, so many people are phoning the organization that it cannot deal with them all
Sense.TRAN: 使(某人的)电话总机应接不暇
Sense.EXAMPLE: Viewers jammed the switchboard with complaints.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众打来的投诉电话令总机应接不暇。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately prevent broadcasts or other electronic signals from being received, by broadcasting signals on the same wavelength
Sense.TRAN: 干扰〔无线电广播或其他电子信号〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is doing something very quickly or well
to dance to music
a post that forms the side of a door or window
a dish from the southern US, containing rice and seafood
Sense.TRAN: 什锦饭〔美国南部菜肴﹐由米饭和海鲜烹调而成〕

Sense.DEF: a big noisy party or event
Sense.TRAN: 喧闹的大型聚会﹔庆祝会

Sense.DEF: stuck and impossible to move
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben had got his finger jammed in the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本的一个手指被门夹住了。

Sense.DEF: full of people or things
Sense.TRAN: 挤满的﹐塞满的﹔拥挤不堪的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The place is jammed. We’ll never get in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那地方拥挤不堪﹐我们绝对进不去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The town was completely jammed with traffic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该镇完全被车辆堵塞了。

Sense.DEF: if people are jammed in a place, there are a lot of them there, so that there is no space between them
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were jammed together, shoulder to shoulder, in the narrow corridor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在狭窄的走道里肩靠着肩挤在一起。

Sense.DEF: lucky – used especially when someone has got something good without having to use any special effort or skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jammy devil won £1,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个走运的家伙赢了 1,000英镑。

Sense.DEF: covered in jam, or like jam
full of people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The place was jam-packed with tourists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地方挤满了游客。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when jazz or rock musicians play music together in an informal way
Sense.TRAN: 爵士乐[摇滚乐]非正式演奏会﹐即兴演奏会
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= January 一月

Sense.DEF: used especially by the police to refer to a woman whose name is not known
Sense.TRAN: 某女﹐无名女士〔尤为警方使用〕

Sense.DEF: a boy and girl who are the main characters in simple British books used for teaching children to read, which were popular in the 1950s and 1960s. Similar stories are sometimes described as ‘Janet and John books’.
Sense.TRAN: 珍妮特和约翰〔20世纪50和60年代畅销英国儿童读物中男﹑女小主人公的名字﹐此类读物有时被称作“珍妮特和约翰童书”〕

Sense.DEF: if metal objects jangle, or if you jangle them, they make a sound when they hit each other
Sense.TRAN: (使)〔金属物件碰撞后〕发出叮当声
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her bracelets jangled on her wrist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的手镯在手腕上叮当作响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dev jangled his car keys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德夫把汽车钥匙弄得叮当响。

Sense.DEF: if your nerves jangle, or if something jangles your nerves, you feel nervous or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: The harsh sound jangled his nerves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺耳的声音刺激着他的神经。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to look after a school or other large building
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校或大楼的〕看门人，门房，管理员

Sense.DEF: the first month of the year, between December and February

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven't heard from him since last January.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从去年1月以来，我就没有得到过他的音讯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She started working there in January.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她1月份开始在那里工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rosie’s party was on January 6th.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗茜的聚会在 1 月 6 日。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He took office on 6th January 1999.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他于 1999 年 1 月 6 日上任。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The package arrived January 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 包裹于 1 月 6 日送达。

Sense.DEF: in Roman mythology, the god of gates and doorways and of new beginnings. Janus is usually shown in pictures with two faces, one of which looks back at the past while the other looks forward towards the future. The expression ‘Janus-faced’ is a literary way of describing someone who is two-facedthey change what they say according to who they are talking to, in an insincere and unpleasant way.
Sense.TRAN: 雅努斯〔古罗马神话中的门神及一切开端之神﹐常被描绘为有两张面孔﹐一张回顾过去﹐另一张展望未来。“雅努斯面孔”用于形容虚伪圆滑的两面派〕

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone from Japan. Do not use this word.
relating to Japan, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 日本的﹔日本人的﹔日语的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Japanese car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本(汽)车

Sense.DEF: people from Japan
the language used in Japan
a trick or joke
a glass container with a wide top and a lid, used for storing food such as jam or honey, or the amount it contains
Sense.TRAN: 〔玻璃〕罐子﹐广口瓶﹔一罐[一瓶]之量
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jam jar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 果酱罐
Sense.EXAMPLE: half a jar of peanut butter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半瓶花生酱

Sense.DEF: a container made of clay, stone etc, used especially in the past for keeping food or drink in
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指过去黏土或石头等制成的用来盛食物或饮料的〕罐﹐坛﹐缸

Sense.DEF: a glass of beer
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d had a few jars down the pub.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经在小酒馆喝了几杯啤酒。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel annoyed or shocked
Sense.EXAMPLE: His enthusiasm jarred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的热情令人厌烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His words jarred Harriet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话让哈丽雅特很生气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The screaming was starting to jar on my nerves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尖叫声让我心烦意乱起来。

Sense.DEF: to shake or hit something in a way that damages it or makes it loose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alice landed badly, jarring her ankle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯着地时姿势不当﹐伤了脚踝。

Sense.DEF: to be different in style or appearance from something else and therefore look strange

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a modern lamp that jarred with the rest of the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里有一盏现代风格的灯﹐和其他东西不协调。

Sense.DEF: words and expressions used in a particular profession or by a particular group of people, which are difficult for other people to understand – often used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep it simple and avoid the use of jargon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单点﹐避免使用术语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: documents full of legal jargon
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通篇都是法律术语的文件

Sense.DEF: a US marinesoldier who serves on a ship
a plant that grows up a wall, frame etc and has small sweet-smelling white or yellow flowers
a red, yellow, or brown stone that is not very valuable
Sense.TRAN: 碧玉〔一种不大值钱的矿石，呈红色﹑黄色或棕色〕

Sense.DEF: a medical condition in which your skin and the white part of your eyes become yellow
thinking that people or things are bad, especially because you have had bad experiences in the past
Sense.TRAN: 悲观灰暗的﹐消极的〔尤因过去的痛苦经历所致〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a very jaundiced view of the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的世界观非常灰暗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She viewed politics and politicians with a jaundiced eyein a jaundiced way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她认为政治和政治人物都很不堪。

Sense.DEF: suffering from jaundice
a short trip for pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weekend jaunt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周末短途旅游

Sense.DEF: showing that you are confident and happy
Sense.TRAN: 满怀自信的﹔轻松自在的﹔无忧无虑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a jaunty walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他步履轻快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hat was set at a jaunty angle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她歪戴着帽子﹐显得很活泼。

Sense.DEF: jaunty music is fast and makes you feel happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jaunty tune
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻松活泼的曲调

Sense.DEF: a computer language, used especially to write programs for the Internet
Sense.TRAN: Java 语言〔一种尤用以编写因特网程序的计算机语言〕

Sense.DEF: coffee
a long stick with a pointed end, thrown as a sport
a sports event in which competitors throw a javelin
one of the two bones that your teeth are in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a broken jaw
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碎裂的颌骨

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an animal with two rows of teeth in its lower jaw
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下颌有两排牙齿的动物

Sense.DEF: the lower part of your face. Its shape is sometimes thought to show your character
Sense.TRAN: 下巴﹐下颌〔下巴形状有时被认为能够显示一个人的性格〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He punched him on the jaw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一拳打在他的下巴上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rugged physique and a strong square jaw
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强健的体格以及结实的方下巴
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got a very determined jaw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一脸坚毅。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone looked surprised or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 某人张口结舌〔形容惊讶或震惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re not serious, are you?’ Ellen’s jaw dropped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你不是认真的﹐对吧？”埃伦惊讶地张大了嘴。

Sense.DEF: to talk

when someone walks across a road at a place where it is dangerous to cross

Sense.DEF: excited

Sense.DEF: similar to the style of jazz music

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’re just jealous of her.

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘jealous about’ someone or something or 或 ‘jealous with’ someone. Say 而要说 jealous of someone or something.

Sense.DEF: feeling angry and unhappy because someone you like or love is showing interest in another person, or another person is showing interest in them

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 吃醋的丈夫/妻子/爱人等

Sense.DEF: wanting to keep or protect something that you have, because you are proud of it

Exponent.DEF: wishing that you had something nice or special that someone else has

Sense.DEF: if you jealously guard or protect something, you try very hard to keep or protect it

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sexual jealousy is a common motive for murder.

Sense.DEF: trousers made of denima strong, usually blue, cotton cloth

PIC.HEADING: JEWELLERY 珠宝，首饰
PIC.PICCONTENT: cameo 多彩浮雕宝石；bead 珠子；bracelet 手链；medallion 圆形徽章；locket 纪念盒吊坠；wedding bands 结婚戒指；chain 项链；pendant 吊坠；bangle 手镯；earrings 耳环；brooch 胸针；casket BrE【英】/jewelry box AmE【美】首饰盒；cuff links 袖扣；a pearl necklace 珍珠项链；ring 戒指；stone 宝石；solitaire 独粒钻戒；tiara 冕状宝石头饰；choker 短项链；chain 链子

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Jewellery is an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: jewellery是不可数名词﹐没有复数形式﹐后接动词的单数形式
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她所有的珠宝都被拿走了。
F2NBox.EXPL: You can refer to one or more pieces/items of jewellery.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示一件或几件珠宝﹐可以说 piece(s)/item(s) of jewellery
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: AShe also lost several pieces of jewellery.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还丢失了好几件珠宝。

Sense.DEF: relating to Jews or Judaism

Subsense.DEF: to dance with a lot of energy to popular music
Subsense.TRAN: 〔跟着流行音乐〕劲舞﹐兴奋地跳舞

Subsense.DEF: to have sex

Sense.DEF: a picture cut up into many pieces that you try to fit together
a very complicated situation, especially one that you are trying to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: As he explained, another piece of the jigsaw fell into place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经他解释﹐这个谜团又有一部分被解开了。

Sense.DEF: a tool for cutting out shapes in thin pieces of wood
a holy war fought by Muslims, or an occasion when a Muslim has to make some kind of sacrifice in his or her life
Sense.TRAN: 〔伊斯兰教徒的〕圣战﹐奉献﹐牺牲

Sense.DEF: a Muslim who is fighting a holy war
Sense.TRAN: 伊斯兰圣战士﹐伊斯兰圣战者

Sense.DEF: a long piece of clothing with long sleeves that is worn by some Muslim women
Sense.TRAN: 〔穆斯林妇女穿的带长袖的〕长袍

Sense.DEF: to suddenly end a close romantic relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She jilted her fiancé just before the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在婚礼前一刻抛弃了未婚夫。

Sense.DEF: the American form of the word jemmy
to shake small metal things together so that they make a sound, or to make this sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: He jingled his car keys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把汽车钥匙弄得叮当响。

Sense.DEF: a short song used in advertisements
the sound of small metal objects being shaken together
Sense.TRAN: 〔金属小物撞击发出的〕叮当声

Sense.DEF: a strong belief that your own country is better than others – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 沙文主义﹐极端爱国主义〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mood of warlike jingoism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好战的沙文主义情绪

Sense.DEF: to change direction suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He jinked left, then right, throwing the plane into sudden turns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然向左﹐然后向右﹐使飞机猛地旋转起来。

Sense.DEF: a genie
someone or something that brings bad luck, or a period of bad luck that results from this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company had suffered so many disasters that some employees feared a jinx.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司遭受了这么多的灾难﹐有些员工担心遇上了霉运。

Sense.DEF: often having bad luck, or making people have bad luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: They seem to be jinxed when it comes to playing in the UK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要在英国比赛﹐他们就好像霉运缠身。

Sense.DEF: a fast jazz dance popular in the 1940s
Sense.TRAN: 吉特巴舞〔20 世纪 40 年代流行的一种快节奏爵士舞〕

Sense.DEF: a nervous worried feeling, especially before an important event
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指重要事情发生前的〕紧张不安
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jitters are worst in the capital, where 61% of people are fearful of a terrorist attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首都的气氛最紧张﹐有61%的人担心会发生恐怖袭击。

Sense.DEF: anxious or nervous
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was probably the tension that made him jittery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能是紧张的局面让他感到焦虑。

Sense.DEF: a very fast dance, popular especially in the 1930s and 1940s, performed to fast jazz music
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指流行于20世纪30和40年代﹑伴随快节奏爵士乐跳的〕摇摆舞

Sense.DEF: statements that you do not believe are true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t give me any of that jive!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别对我胡说八道！

Sense.DEF: to dance a jive
to try to make someone believe something that is not true

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= junior
Sense.DEF: used after the name of a man who has the same name as his father
Sense.TRAN: 小〔置于与父亲同名的男子姓名之后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sammy Davis Jnr
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小萨米·戴维斯

Sense.DEF: the regular paid work that you do for an employer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you enjoy your job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢自己的工作吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the first paid job I ever had.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我第一份拿工资的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been in the job for six years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他干这份工作有六年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m looking for a new job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在找一份新工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your pension can be affected if you change jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 换工作的话﹐会影响到你的退休金。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually ask What do you do? or What does she/he do? when asking what someone’s job is.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐问到某人职业时﹐一般说 What do you do? 或 What does she/he do?

Sense.DEF: something that you are responsible for doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Raising kids can be a difficult job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抚养孩子可是件难事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s my job to make sure that the work is finished on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的任务是确保工作按时完成。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The job of the jury is to assess the credibility of the witness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团的职责是判断证人是否可信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was given the job of making sure that everyone had enough to drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我的任务是确保每个人都有足够喝的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All too often councils fall down on the jobnot do what they should of keeping the streets clean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政服务机构屡屡未能尽到保持街道清洁的职责。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use task or duty rather than job, as they sound more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们通常不用 job﹐而用 task 或 duty﹐因为这两个词听上去更正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Our first task was to prepare the agenda for the meeting.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的第一项任务是为这次会议准备议程表。

Sense.DEF: a particular thing you have to do, considered as work
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents were always finding little jobs for me to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母老是找些小事情给我做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Filleting fish can be quite a fiddly job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剔鱼骨可是件麻烦事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tiling the bathroom is going to be a big job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给浴室贴瓷砖将是个大工程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam does odd jobssmall jobs in the house or garden for friends and neighbours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆为朋友和邻居打打零工。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The job of choosing the right computer for you is made easy by this magazine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了这本杂志﹐挑选一台合适的电脑就变得容易了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to get on with the job of finding someone to replace him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要继续找人来替代他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Whoever did the plastering did a brilliant job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抹泥灰的那个人干得真不错。

GramExa.PROPFORM: make a good/bad etc job of (doing) sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hates doing the cleaning, but she always makes a good job of it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不喜欢做清洁工作﹐但一直做得很出色。

Subsense.DEF: while you are doing a particular job
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Most clerical training is done on the job.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分文书培训都是在职进行的。

Subsense.DEF: doing a particular job
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got some of our best people on the job.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有一些最优秀的人才在做这项工作。

Subsense.DEF: having sex

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is not your fault if you have to do something in your work that other people do not like
Sense.TRAN: 我只是在做分内的事〔用来表示所做的事情属于职责范围﹐即使别人不喜欢﹐也非自己的过错〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s more than my job’s worth
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you cannot do what they want because you would lose your job if you did – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 那会让我丢饭碗的〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to have the effect or produce the result that you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: A little more glue should do the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再加一点胶水就成了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has done something that was necessary, especially quickly and easily
Sense.TRAN: 成了﹐好了〔尤指迅速轻松地完成了必须做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When we scored three times in the first half, we thought, ‘Job done.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上半场我们进了三个球﹐当时我们就想:“赢定了。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a job doing sth/have a job to do sth
Sense.DEF: to have difficulty doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we might have a job parking in town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我们在商业区找到停车位可能很难。

Sense.DEF: to have a damaging effect on someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事造成破坏性结果
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun does quite a job on people’s skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳光对人的皮肤相当有害。

Sense.DEF: an action done by a computer
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机完成的〕(一件)作业﹐工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: a print job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打印作业

Sense.DEF: a crime in which money is stolen from a bank, company etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bank job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行劫案
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police believe it was an inside jobdone by someone who works for the company where the crime happens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为这是一起内部盗窃案。

Sense.DEF: an operation to improve the appearance of your nose or breasts
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looks completely different in this photo – she must have had a nose job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张照片上的她看起来完全不一样——她肯定整过鼻子了。

Sense.DEF: exactly what is needed for a particular purpose or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: This bag is just the job for carrying your sports gear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个包正好可以用来装你的运动装备。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is of a particular type
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于说明某物属于某一类型〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack’s got a new car – a red two-seater job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克买了辆新车﹐是红色﹑双人座的那种。

Sense.DEF: when someone in an important position gives work to their friends, especially when this gives the friends an unfair advantage
Sense.TRAN: 为亲信安排的工作﹐任人唯亲
Sense.EXAMPLE: The council chief was suspended over allegations of jobs for the boys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政会主席因被指控任人唯亲而被停职。

Sense.DEF: something that you have to do even if you do not enjoy it
a mixed group of things that are sold together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a job lot of furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 混杂在一起成批出售的家具

Crossrefto.REFLEX: make the best of a bad job

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mark doesn’t have a job right now.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克目前没有工作。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve applied for a job at the university.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已申请了一份大学里的工作。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Well, Miss Taylor, we’d like to offer you the job.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐泰勒小姐﹐我们想把这份工作给你。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Eventually, Mary got a job as a waitress.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽最后找到了一份女服务员的工作。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My husband finally landed a job in marketing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我丈夫最后竟得到了一份做营销的工作。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: accept a job you are offered
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was so desperate that I took the first job that came along.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走投无路﹐遇到第一份工作就接受了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The job is only temporary, but I’m hoping it will be made permanent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是份临时工作﹐但我希望以后能转成长久的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had a part-time job at the pet shop.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在宠物店干一份兼职工作。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a job that is likely to continue
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I haven’t had a steady job since last March.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年 3 月以来我就一直没有稳定的工作。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a job with low wages and no chance of progress
the enjoyment you get from your job
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Levels of job satisfaction vary between departments.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 各部门的工作满意度各不相同。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: how permanent your job is likely to be
Collocate.EXAMPLE: As an actor, he has very little job security.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 身为演员﹐他的工作很不稳定。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The factory is closing, with 600 job losses.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂将要关闭﹐会导致600人失业。

Exponent.DEF: the regular paid work that you do for an employer
Exponent.TRAN: 工作﹐职位﹐职业〔指为雇主工作〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a full-time job
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 全职工作
Exponent.EXAMPLE: John got a job in a car factory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰在一家汽车厂工作。

Exponent.DEF: activities that you are paid for doing – used either when you work for an employer or when you work in your own business
Exponent.TRAN: 工作﹐职业〔指为雇主工作或自雇〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I started work when I was 18.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我18岁开始工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He graduated from college last year and is still looking for work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去年大学毕业﹐至今仍在找工作。

Exponent.DEF: a job for which you need special education and training
Exponent.TRAN: 〔需特别教育和训练的〕职业﹐行业
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are now a lot more women in the legal profession.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在从事法律行业的女性多了许多。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many teachers are leaving the profession.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前有许多教师离开教育行业。

Exponent.DEF: a job, or a type of job – often used on official documents
Exponent.TRAN: 工作﹐职业〔常用于正式文件〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Please give your name, age, and occupation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请填写你的姓名﹑年龄和职业。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a traditionally male occupation
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统上由男性从事的职业

Exponent.DEF: the work you do or plan to do for most of your life
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m interested in a career in journalism.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有意从事新闻工作。

Exponent.DEF: a particular job within an organization
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I am writing to apply for the position of technical assistant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我写信来申请技术助理一职。

Exponent.DEF: a job, especially an important one in a large organization
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指大机构内重要的〕职位﹐职务
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She has held the post of managing director for two years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担任总经理一职已有两年。

Exponent.DEF: a job that is available for someone to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hospital has been unable to fill the vacancy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家医院找不到人来填补这个空缺。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are very few openings in scientific research.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学研究领域的职位空缺极少。

Exponent.DEF: an important job which someone is asked to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He took an appointment as US trade ambassador in Geneva.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接受任命﹐出任美国驻日内瓦贸易代表。

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which someone is sent somewhere to do a job for a period of time by the organization they work for
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This was his first posting outside the UK.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他第一次被派驻英国以外任职。

Exponent.DEF: the fact of having a job
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The factory will provide employment for local people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂将为当地人提供就业。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is buying and selling stocks and shares
someone who does small pieces of work for different people
Sense.TRAN: 打零工的建筑工人/园丁/印刷工人等

Sense.DEF: a place run by the British government, where jobs are advertised and training courses are provided for people who are looking for work
the process of making more paid jobs available
Sense.EXAMPLE: job creation schemes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提供就业机会的计划

Sense.DEF: an official list of the work and responsibilities that you have in your job
without a job
people who are jobless
someone who does not have a job and is looking for one
an arrangement by which two people both work part-time doing the same job
someone who follows the rules of their job too exactly without using any imagination
Sense.TRAN: 工作中墨守成规的人﹐工作死板的人

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a student, who plays a lot of sport and is often considered to be stupid
Sense.TRAN: 成天运动的笨家伙〔尤指学生〕

Sense.DEF: someone from Scotland – sometimes used in an insulting way
Sense.TRAN: 苏格兰佬〔有时含侮辱意味〕

Sense.DEF: a disc jockey
Sense.TRAN: 〔电台〕音乐唱片节目主持人﹔〔夜总会〕舞曲唱片播放员

Sense.DEF: someone who rides horses in races
to compete strongly to get into the best position or situation, or to get the most power
Sense.TRAN: 〔为获得最佳位置﹑最有利形势或最大权力而〕激烈竞争

GramExa.EXAMPLE: photographers jockeying for position at the bar
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在酒吧中争夺最佳位置的摄影师们

Sense.EXAMPLE: After the war, rival politicians began to jockey for power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后﹐敌对的政客们开始激烈地争权。

Sense.DEF: a type of men’s cotton underwear that fits very tightly
a piece of men’s underwear that supports their sex organs during sport
joking or humorous
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sounded in a jocular mood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听上去心情很好。

Sense.DEF: a special type of trousers that you wear when riding horses
the ordinary average person
someone who is a typical example of people in a particular situation or involved in a particular activity
a young kangaroo
to run slowly and steadily, especially as a way of exercising
Sense.EXAMPLE: I go jogging every morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每天早晨都去慢跑。

Sense.DEF: to knock or push something lightly by mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: You jogged my elbow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你碰到了我的胳膊肘。

Sense.DEF: to make someone remember something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps this photo will help to jog your memory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许这张照片能唤起你的回忆。

Sense.DEF: to continue in the same way as usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were jogging along comfortably and enjoying our work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作得很愉快。

Sense.DEF: a slow steady run, especially done as a way of exercising
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为锻炼身体而进行的〕慢跑
Sense.EXAMPLE: He set off along the riverbank at a jog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始沿着河岸慢跑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike goes for a two-mile jogevery morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克每天早上慢跑两英里。

Sense.DEF: a light knock or push done by accident
someone who runs slowly and steadily as a way of exercising
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jogger out for his early morning run
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大清早在外面慢跑锻炼的人

Sense.DEF: the activity of running slowly and steadily as a way of exercising
loose thick cotton clothes that you wear when you are jogging
to shake or move up and down slightly, or to make something move in this way
a toilet
the customer of a prostitute
England or the English people
Sense.TRAN: 约翰牛〔指英国或英国人〕

Sense.DEF: a typical Englishman, especially one who does not like foreigners
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不喜欢外国人的〕典型的英国人

Sense.DEF: used especially by the police to refer to a man whose name is not known
Sense.TRAN: 某男﹐无名男士〔尤为警方使用〕

Sense.DEF: a condom
a man

a place in northeast Scotland that is thought of as the most northern part of the UK, although in fact it is not. It is used especially in the phrase ‘from John o’ Groats to Land’s End’, Land’s End being thought of as the furthest point in the southwest of the UK.
Sense.TRAN: 约翰岬角〔苏格兰东北部一地﹐被误认为是英国最北端﹔尤用于短语 from John o’ Groats to Land’s End﹐意为“从英国的极北到极南”〕

Sense.DEF: a feeling of general pleasure and excitement
to become a member of an organization, society, or group
Sense.EXAMPLE: When did you join the Labour Party?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你何时加入工党的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to join the army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定去参军。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can enjoy a sport without joining a club or belonging to a team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不加盟俱乐部或球队也可以享受体育运动的乐趣。

Sense.DEF: to begin to take part in an activity that other people are involved in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many sacrificed their weekend to join the hunt for the missing girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人牺牲周末时间﹐加入了寻找失踪女孩的行动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the benefits of joining our pension scheme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加我们的退休金计划的好处
Sense.EXAMPLE: Church leaders have joined the campaign to end foxhunting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会领袖参与了禁止猎狐的运动。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere in order to be with someone or do something with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She joined her aunt in the sitting room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她到客厅去陪她姑妈了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The immigrants were soon joined by their wives and children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些移民的妻子和子女很快就来与他们团聚了。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say ‘join with’ someone. Join is always followed by an object in this sense. 不要说join with 某人﹐用于此义时join 后总是直接跟宾语: I’ll join you later. 我稍后会加入你们。

Sense.DEF: to do something together with someone else, or as a group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I invited them to join us for a glass of wine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我邀请他们和我们一起喝杯酒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sure you’ll all join me in thanking today’s speaker.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信大家会和我一起来感谢今天的演讲者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parents have joined with health experts to produce a video for bereaved families.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长们和医疗专家一起为痛失亲人的家庭制作录像。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Three police forces have joined together to buy a helicopter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三支警察部队共同出资购买一架直升机。

Subsense.DEF: to connect or fasten things together
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Join the two pieces of wood with strong glue.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用强力胶水把两块木头黏合起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The island is joined to the mainland by a causeway.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条堤道将这座岛屿与大陆相连。

Subsense.DEF: if two roads, rivers etc join, they come together and become connected at a particular point
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Finally, we arrived at Dartmouth, where the River Dart joins the sea.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我们到达达特茅斯﹐达特河就在那里汇入大海。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the point where the two roads join
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两条道路的汇合点

Sense.DEF: to go and stand at the end of a line of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went in and joined the queue for the toilets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走进去排队上厕所。

Sense.DEF: if people join hands, they hold each other’s hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: They joined hands and danced round and round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们手拉手转着圈跳舞。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you and a lot of other people are in the same situation
Sense.TRAN: 彼此彼此〔指你和其他许多人的境况一样〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m having difficulty knowing what today’s debate is about.’ ‘Join the club, Geoffrey.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我听不懂今天的辩论在讲些什么。” “彼此彼此﹐乔弗里。

Sense.DEF: to begin fighting
formal to be married
if two people are joined at the hip, they are always together and are very friendly – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个人要好得〕形影不离〔常含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to take part in something that a group of people are doing or that someone else does
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the evening there was a barbecue, with the whole village joining in the fun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上有烧烤活动﹐全村人欢聚一堂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stared at them without joining in the conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他盯着他们看﹐没有参与交谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He laughed loudly, and Mattie joined in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大声笑了起来﹐马蒂也跟着笑了。

Sense.DEF: to become a member of the army, navy, or air force
to connect things, or to become connected

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dots are joined up by a line.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些点由一条线连接起来。

Sense.DEF: to combine with or meet other people in order to do something
Sense.TRAN: 与〔某人〕结伙〔干某事〕﹐联合
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three months ago, they joined up with another big company that sells arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三个月前﹐他们和另一家出售武器的大公司联手。

Sense.DEF: a place where two parts of an object are connected or fastened together
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been glued back together so well you can hardly see the join.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重新粘得很好﹐几乎看不出接缝。

Sense.DEF: joined-up writing has all the letters in each word connected to each other
joined-up systems, institutions etc combine different groups, ideas, or parts in a way that works well
Sense.EXAMPLE: the need for joined-up thinking between departments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各部门想法协调的必要性

Sense.DEF: someone who makes wooden doors, window frames etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔制造木门﹑窗框等的〕细木工人

Sense.DEF: the trade and work of a joiner
involving two or more people or groups, or owned or shared by them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two ministers have issued a joint statement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位部长发布了一项联合声明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both companies are involved in the joint development of a new medium-sized car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两家公司联合开发一款新的中型汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meal was a joint efforttwo or more people worked on it together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这顿饭是大家一起做的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manchester United and Arsenal are joint favourites to win the title are thought to have the same chance of winning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼联和阿森纳均为夺冠的热门球队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both parties must sign the form if the account is to be in joint namesbelong to two named people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果这是联名账户的话﹐双方都必须在表格上签名。

Sense.DEF: a business activity begun by two or more people or companies working together
a decision or law agreed by both houses of the US Congress and signed by the president
Sense.TRAN: 〔由美国参众两院通过并经总统签署的〕共同决议

RunOn.EXAMPLE: tenants who are jointly responsible for their rent

Sense.DEF: a part of your body that can bend because two bones meet there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a permanently damaged knee joint
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 永久性损伤的膝关节

Sense.DEF: a large piece of meat, usually containing a bone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a joint of beef
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大块牛肉

Sense.DEF: a place where two things or parts of an object are joined together
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个物体或部分的〕接合处﹔接缝﹔接头
Sense.EXAMPLE: What should I use to seal the joint between the carport roof and the house wall?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我应该用什么材料填补车棚顶和房屋墙面的接缝？

Subsense.DEF: if a bone in your body is out of joint, it has been pushed out of its correct position
if a system, group etc is out of joint, it is not working properly
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Something is out of joint in our society.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的社会有些方面不正常。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: put sb’s nose out of joint

Sense.DEF: a cheap bar, club, or restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hamburger joint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉堡包店

Sense.DEF: a cigarette containing cannabis
to cut meat into joints
having joints and able to move and bend
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jointed puppet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关节能活动的木偶

Sense.DEF: a university degree course in Britain in which two main subjects are studied
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学的〕双学位课程〔即攻读两门主要学科〕

Sense.DEF: a company that is owned by all the people with shares in it
one of the beams that support a floor or ceiling
something that you say or do to make people laugh, especially a funny story or trick

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a joke about absent-minded professors
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于糊涂教授的一个笑话

Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t go out with someone for a joke, could you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不能拿谈恋爱当儿戏﹐对不对？

Sense.DEF: to be completely useless, stupid, or unreasonable
Sense.TRAN: 简直是在开玩笑﹔完全是一场闹剧
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole meeting was a joke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个会议完全是一场闹剧。

Sense.DEF: a situation that has got beyond a joke has become serious and worrying
Sense.EXAMPLE: This rain’s getting beyond a joke – let’s go inside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这雨越下越大了﹐我们进去吧。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that a situation is serious or that someone really means what they say
Sense.TRAN: 某事并非开玩笑〔用来强调情况严重或某人说的话是认真的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The risk he’s taking is no joke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冒的这个险非同小可。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s no joke bringing up a child on your own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独自抚养小孩可不是好玩的事情。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is able to laugh at jokes about themselves
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your problem is you just can’t take a joke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的问题就是开不起玩笑。

Sense.DEF: to treat something serious as if it was intended to be funny
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could not bring himself to apologise. Instead, he tried to make a joke of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没法开口道歉﹐就想拿这件事情开个玩笑蒙混过去。

Sense.DEF: a situation that someone else thinks is funny but you do not
Sense.TRAN: 某人觉得好玩的事〔但你本人却并不这么认为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look, if this is your idea of a joke, I don’t find it at all funny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐虽然你认为这很好笑﹐我却一点都不觉得。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something has happened to make someone seem stupid, especially when they were trying to make other people seem stupid
Sense.TRAN: 开玩笑反而开到自己身上了﹔作弄别人反而作弄到自己身上

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was always telling jokes and making people laugh.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是讲笑话逗人乐。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say something intended to be funny
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was cracking jokes and seemed relaxed and happy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在开玩笑﹐看上去轻松愉快。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: understand a joke and find it funny
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She never gets my jokes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从来都不懂我的笑话。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 听了某人的笑话而大笑

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: trick someone to make people laugh

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I heard a really good joke the other day.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一天我听到一个很有趣的笑话。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Dad was known for his bad jokes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都知道爸爸的笑话很无趣。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 残忍的/令人反感的笑话

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that only a few people who are involved in something will understand
people don’t find a joke funny
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His practical jokes usually fell flat.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那些恶作剧通常都没有人笑。

Collocate.COLLOC: be the butt of a joke
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be the person a joke is made about, so that people laugh at you

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说'say a joke'. Say 而要说 tell a joke.

Sense.DEF: to say things that are intended to be funny and that you do not really mean

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I never joke about money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从不拿钱开玩笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As we left the hospital, he joked with the staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们离开医院时﹐他和医务人员开着玩笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His father joked that his son was trying to put him out of business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲开玩笑说他儿子想要他破产。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Calm down, Jo, I was only joking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔﹐别生气﹐我不过是开玩笑。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that what they are suggesting is so strange or silly that you cannot believe that they are serious
Sense.TRAN: 你(一定)是在开玩笑吧〔用来表示某人的话很奇怪或愚蠢﹐你无法相信他们是认真的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Tell him.’ ‘You must be joking – he’d never believe me.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “告诉他。” “你一定是在开玩笑吧﹐他绝不会相信我的。

Sense.DEF: used before you say something serious after you have been joking
Sense.TRAN: 言归正传﹐说正经的〔用来表示停止开玩笑﹐开始说严肃的事〕

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a way you think is stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look at that joker – he’s doing 25 miles an hour at the most.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瞧那个傻瓜﹐他的时速最多25英里。

Sense.DEF: a playing card that has no fixed value and is only used in some card games
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些纸牌游戏中可充作任何点数的〕百搭牌

Sense.DEF: someone who makes a lot of jokes
something or someone whose effect on future events cannot be known
Sense.TRAN: 难以预料的事﹔难以捉摸的人

Sense.DEF: not serious, and tending to make people laugh
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave was a sweet man, very jokey about everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫这个人很可爱﹐做什么事都令人发笑。

Sense.DEF: to get pleasure from a particular experience or activity, especially a strange activity
fun and enjoyment
when people are happy and enjoying themselves
Sense.EXAMPLE: a night of riotous jollity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一夜的纵情欢闹

Sense.DEF: happy and enjoying yourself
Sense.TRAN: 兴高采烈的﹐开心愉快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everybody was in a very relaxed and jolly mood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家的心情都非常轻松愉快。

Sense.DEF: very pleasant and enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a jolly time with the family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们和家人在一起过得很愉快。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sounds like a jolly good idea to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这是个好主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was all jolly good fun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个很好玩。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize an opinion or to show that you are annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 当然﹐无疑〔用于强调某个观点或表示生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Right, I’m going to clear up, and you can jolly well help me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没错﹐我要打扫了﹐而你也当然可以帮我忙啊。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are pleased by what someone has just said
Sense.TRAN: 说得好！〔用来表示你对某人刚刚所说的话感到满意〕

Sense.DEF: to try to make someone do something faster by encouraging them
Sense.TRAN: 鼓励某人〔加快速度做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He jollied people along and got useful information out of them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他鼓励人们说出来﹐从而获得了有用的信息。

Sense.DEF: to gently persuade someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She jollied the children into going for a walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她哄孩子们去散步。

Sense.DEF: to make an event or place more pleasant or exciting
a black flag with a picture of bones on it, used in the past by pirates
to move suddenly and roughly, or to make someone or something move in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: We jolted along rough wet roads through an endless banana plantation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们沿崎岖潮湿的公路颠簸着驶过无边无际的香蕉种植园。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a sudden shock or surprise
Sense.EXAMPLE: The phone jolted him awake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话铃声把他惊醒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It jolted me into making the decision to quit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事情让我警醒﹐并下决心辞职。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her sharp words seemed to jolt him out of his depression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那些尖锐的话好像使他从沮丧中清醒过来。

Sense.DEF: a sudden shock

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Melanie experienced a jolt of surprise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅拉妮感到一阵惊诧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Henry sat up with a jolt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利吃惊得坐了起来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The oil crisis has given the government quite a jolt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油危机让政府着实吃了一惊。

Sense.DEF: a sudden rough shaking movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: People felt the first jolt of the earthquake at about 8 am.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们感觉到地震的第一下晃动大约是在上午 8 点钟。

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone or laugh at them in a gentle joking way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guys josh him and call him an egghead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大伙儿取笑他﹐叫他书呆子。

Sense.DEF: a stick of incense
to push or knock against someone in a crowd, especially so that you can get somewhere or do something before other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔在人群中〕挤﹐推﹐撞〔尤指为了先于他人前往某处或做某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Followers of the president jostled for position in front of the TV cameras.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的拥护者们互相推搡着争抢电视摄像机前面的位置。

Sense.DEF: to compete for something such as attention or a reward
Sense.EXAMPLE: A thousand thoughts were jostling around inside my mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 千头万绪在我脑海中翻涌。

Sense.DEF: to write a short piece of information quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me jot down your number and I’ll call you tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我记下你的号码﹐明天给你打电话。

Sense.DEF: not at all or none at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was not a jot of humour in the man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这人没有一点幽默感。

Sense.DEF: a small book for writing notes in
short notes, usually written to remind yourself about something
Sense.TRAN: 〔为提醒自己而写的〕简短记事
Sense.EXAMPLE: her private jottings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的私人便条

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring energy or work
Sense.TRAN: 焦耳〔能或功的计量单位〕

Sense.DEF: a serious magazine produced for professional people or those with a particular interest
Sense.TRAN: 〔供专业人士或具有某种兴趣的人读的〕期刊﹐杂志
Sense.EXAMPLE: the British Medical Journal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《英国医学杂志》

Sense.DEF: a written record that you make of the things that happen to you each day
Sense.EXAMPLE: He decided to keep a journal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决定记日记。

Sense.DEF: language that is typical of newspapers
the job or activity of writing news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio
Sense.EXAMPLE: a career in journalism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻工作生涯
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hospital has been the target of investigative journalismjournalism that examines an event or situation in order to find out the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家医院成了调查报道的目标。

Sense.DEF: someone who writes news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-known journalist and broadcaster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位著名的新闻记者兼播音员

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially over a long distance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: my journey to China
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的中国之行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a journey across Europe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 横贯欧洲之旅

Sense.EXAMPLE: the friends they made on the journey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在旅途中交下的朋友

Sense.DEF: a long and often difficult process by which someone or something changes and develops
Sense.EXAMPLE: our journey through life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的人生历程
Sense.EXAMPLE: The novel is an account of his spiritual journey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本小说讲述了他的心路历程。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I still use my car, but now I make fewer journeys.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仍然开车﹐但现在出行次数减少了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are going on a journey to a strange country.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将要去一个陌生的国家旅行。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He began the journey home across London.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿过伦敦﹐踏上了回家的旅程。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make a short stop on a journey

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 汽车/飞机/公共汽车等旅行
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the six-hour train journey to London
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 前往伦敦的六小时火车车程

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They arrived tired from their long journey.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过长途旅行﹐他们抵达时已筋疲力尽。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was a difficult journey, especially in the winter months.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅途很艰辛﹐尤其是在冬季的那几个月。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used especially to wish someone a good journey
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Have a safe journey.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一路平安。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very long and eventful journey
one that did not achieve the result you wanted
the journey back from a place

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We set off on the final leg of our journey.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们踏上了最后一段旅程。

Exponent.DEF: an occasion when you travel from one place to another – used especially about travelling a long distance, or travelling somewhere regularly
Exponent.TRAN: 【尤英】〔尤指长途或经常性的〕旅行﹐旅程
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The journey took us over three hours.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们路上花了三个多小时。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My journey to work normally takes around 30 minutes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上班路上通常要花30分钟左右。

Exponent.DEF: a journey to visit a place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How about a trip to the seaside on Saturday?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六去海边玩怎么样？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a business trip
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 商务旅行

Exponent.DEF: a journey for pleasure, during which you visit several different towns, areas etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Last summer we went on a tour of Europe.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年夏天我们去欧洲旅游了。

Exponent.DEF: a short journey by a group of people to visit a place, especially while they are on holiday
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指节假日时集体的〕短途旅行﹐远足
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cost of the holiday includes excursions to nearby places of interest.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 度假费用包括去附近旅游点的短程旅行。

Exponent.DEF: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指到危险或陌生地方的〕远征﹐探险﹐考察
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Scott’s expedition to the Antarctic
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯科特的南极探险
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a military expedition
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 出兵远征

Exponent.DEF: the journey to and from work that someone does every day
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People are fed up with the daily commute on overcrowded trains.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们厌倦了每天挤火车上下班。

Exponent.DEF: a journey to a holy place for religious reasons
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the annual pilgrimage to Mecca
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年一度的麦加朝圣

Exponent.DEF: a long journey, for example over mountains or through forests, especially one that people do on foot for pleasure
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指以徒步为乐的〕长途旅行﹔徒步旅行
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a trek across the Atlas Mountains
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿越阿特拉斯山脉的徒步旅行

Exponent.DEF: the general activity of moving from one place to another
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her new job involves a lot of travel.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的新工作需要经常出差。

Exponent.DEF: someone’s journeys to or in places that are far away
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m longing to hear all about your travels in China.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我渴望着听你讲讲你的中国之行。

Section.SECHEADING: BY PLANE/BOAT/CAR/BICYCLE ETC 乘飞机/船/汽车/自行车等

Exponent.DEF: a journey by air
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You should check in at the airport two hours before your flight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应在起飞前两小时去机场办理登机手续。

Exponent.DEF: a long journey over the sea
Exponent.EXAMPLE: MacArthur’s epic round-the-world voyage
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克阿瑟艰苦卓绝的环球航行

Exponent.DEF: a short journey by boat from one piece of land to another
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A 30-minute ferry crossing takes you to the island.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘渡船30分钟可到岛上。

Exponent.DEF: a journey by boat for pleasure
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a Mediterranean cruise
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地中海游轮之旅
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a cruise down the Nile
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼罗河游轮之旅

Exponent.DEF: a journey in a car, often for pleasure
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常为寻找乐趣的〕驱车旅行﹐驾车兜风
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The drive through the mountains was absolutely beautiful.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 驱车穿越群山﹐感觉美极了。

Exponent.DEF: a short journey in a car, or on a bicycle or horse
Exponent.TRAN: 〔乘汽车﹑骑自行车或骑马的〕短途旅程
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a 20-minute taxi ride to the station.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘出租车去车站要20分钟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a bike ride
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 骑自行车出行

Sense.DEF: to travel
Sense.EXAMPLE: They left the town and journeyed south.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们离开小镇﹐去南方旅行。

Sense.DEF: a trained worker who works for someone else
an experienced worker whose work is acceptable but not excellent
Sense.TRAN: 〔技术合格但并不出色的〕熟手﹐熟练工

Sense.DEF: a journalist
to fight with lanceslong sticks while riding horses, as part of a formal competition in the past
to compete or argue with someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The minister and I have often jousted with each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和部长常常互相争论。

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise or to emphasize something
Sense.TRAN: 啊！哎呀！〔用来表示惊讶或强调某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: By Jove, you’re right!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐你说得对！

Sense.DEF: friendly and happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He addressed me in a jovial manner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他友好地跟我说话。

Sense.DEF: the skin that covers your lower jaw on either side of your face
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man with heavy jowlsjowls that hang down slightly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个下巴上赘肉很厚的男人

Sense.DEF: great happiness and pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: the look of joy on her face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上的喜悦表情

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I leaped into the air with joy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开心得蹦了起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wept for joy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜极而泣。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t exactly jump for joyI was not very pleased when I heard the news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到这个消息时并没有特别高兴。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Joy is used especially in literature. In everyday English, rather than say they did something with joy, people usually say that they were (really) pleased/happy/glad to do it.
F2NBox.TRAN: joy尤用于文学作品。在日常英语中﹐人们一般不说 did something with joy﹐而是说 was (really) pleased/happy/glad to do something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Thank you for your letter. I was really pleased to get it.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你的来信﹐收到时我非常高兴。

Sense.DEF: something or someone that gives you happiness and pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 使人高兴的事物[人]﹐乐趣

GramExa.EXAMPLE: one of the joys of travelling alone
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 独自旅行的乐趣之一

Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden was his pride and joy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座花园是他的骄傲和乐趣所在。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be a joy to watch/drive/use etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children’s singing was a joy to listen to.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听孩子们唱歌是一桩乐事。

Sense.DEF: if you have no joy, you do not succeed in getting something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I phoned the pub, but no joy. The landlord didn’t know where she was.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给酒馆打了电话﹐但没有结果。老板不知道她在哪里。

Collocate.COLLOC: be filled with joy/be full of joy
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was full of joy at the thought of seeing her again.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想到要与她重逢﹐我就满心欢喜。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She began to cry again, but they were tears of joy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又哭了起来﹐但那是喜悦的泪水。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A feeling of total joy swept over him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他顿时感到十分欢乐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: To her great joy, she became the mother of two beautiful baby girls.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 使她万分高兴的是﹐她生下一对漂亮女婴。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a lot of joy, not mixed with other feelings
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was a moment of pure joy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一刻无比欢乐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her children have brought her great joy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们给她带来极大的快乐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His music has given people a lot of joy over the years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年来他的音乐带给人们许多快乐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had never felt the joy of watching the seasons come and go.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来没有体验过看四季变化所带来的那种快乐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She tried to stay calm, but she was secretly jumping for joy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她努力保持平静﹐但心里却高兴得直想跳起来。

Sense.DEF: to be happy because of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔因某事而〕感到高兴﹐感到欣喜

Sense.DEF: very happy, or likely to make people very happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christmas is a joyful occasion for children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节是孩子们的开心时刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the joyful news
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜讯

Sense.DEF: without any happiness at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: a joyless marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的婚姻

Sense.DEF: very happy, or likely to make people very happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a joyous occasion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢乐的场合
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our music is a joyous celebration of life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的音乐是对生活的欢乐颂扬。

Sense.DEF: the crime of stealing a car and driving it in a fast and dangerous way for fun
Sense.TRAN: 用偷来的车兜风〔开快车和危险驾驶〕﹔偷车兜风(罪)

Sense.DEF: an upright handle that you use to control something such as an aircraft or a computer game
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机的〕操纵杆﹔〔电脑游戏的〕控制杆﹐游戏杆
the abbreviation of 缩写= Justice of the Peace 治安法官

Sense.DEF: a type of computer file used on the Internet that contains pictures, photo­graphs, or other images
Sense.TRAN: 联合图像专家组(文件)〔计算机上使用的一种文件﹐包含图片﹑照片或其他图像〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= junior, used after the name of a man who has the same name as his father【美】小〔置于与父亲同名的男子姓名之后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alan Parks, Jr.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小艾伦·帕克斯

Sense.DEF: extremely happy and pleased because of a success
Sense.TRAN: 〔因成功而〕欢腾的﹐兴高采烈的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Radicals were jubilant at getting rid of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激进分子因为除掉了他而欣喜若狂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fans were in jubilant mood as they left the stadium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷们离开体育场时兴高采烈。

Sense.DEF: happiness and pleasure because you have been successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was jubilation that a local team had come first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地一支球队名列第一﹐因此到处洋溢着欢乐的气氛。

Sense.DEF: a date that is celebrated because it is exactly 25 years, 50 years etc after an important event
Sense.TRAN: 〔重要事件 25 年﹑50 年等的〕周年纪念

Sense.DEF: the Jewish religion based on the sacred books known as the Hebrew Scriptures. These writings contain many of the books that are also in the Old Testament of the Christian bible.
someone who is not loyal to a friend
Sense.TRAN: 犹大﹐出卖朋友的人﹔叛徒

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle or machine judders, it shakes violently
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine juddered to life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎剧烈震动着发动起来了。

Sense.DEF: the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trial judge specifies the number of years to be spent in prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由主审法官确定刑期。

GramExa.GLOSS: a judge in a particular court
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 联邦法院/高等法院等法官

Sense.DEF: someone who decides on the result of a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: The panel of judges included several well-known writers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 评审团包括几位著名作家。

Sense.DEF: someone whose opinion on something is usually right or wrong
Sense.TRAN: 对某事物判断力很好/很差的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sandra’s a very good judge of character.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德拉很善于判断人的性格。

Sense.DEF: to be the person whose opinion on something matters or is accepted
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one else can say what its value to you is – only you can be the judge of that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他人谁也无法说明它对于你的意义﹐唯有你自己才能作出评判。

Sense.LEXUNIT: let me be the judge of that
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone angrily that you do not need their advice
Sense.TRAN: 我自己会判断〔用于生气地向某人表示你不需要其劝告〕

Sense.DEF: to make or have the power to make an important decision affecting someone by yourself – used showing disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 有权决定〔影响他人的事〕﹐说了算〔用作贬义〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is as sober as a judge is not drunk at all
to form or give an opinion about someone or something after thinking carefully about all the information you know about them
Sense.TRAN: 〔认真考虑后〕认为﹔判断﹔断定﹔评价
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should never judge a person by their looks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 决不要以貌取人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Judge us on the improvements we make in the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请根据我们在经济方面取得的进步来评价我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The therapist judged that Margaret had made a serious attempt to kill herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗专家断定玛格丽特曾真的企图自杀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: pollutants that were judged hazardous to human health
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被认为对人体健康有害的污染物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am in no position to judge whether what she is doing is right or wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无权评判她在做的事是对是错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economic results of the reforms are very difficult to judge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些改革所带来的经济成效很难评价。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The likelihood of future bombs was impossible to judge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未来发生爆炸案的可能性无法预测。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We judge the success of a product by the number of sales it brings in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以销量来评价一种产品成功与否。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His conduct, judged objectively by what he has done, is dishonest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为﹐从他所做的这一切客观地来评价﹐是不诚实的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robert wanted to go and help him, but judged it best to stay where he was.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯特想过去帮他﹐但考虑之后还是觉得待在原地为妙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do not judge her too harshly, as she was very young at the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对她的评价不要太苛刻﹐毕竟那时候她还很年轻。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are making a guess based on what you have just seen, heard, or learned
Sense.TRAN: 依据某事〔所见﹑所闻或所学〕来判断
Sense.EXAMPLE: Judging by his jovial manner, he must have enjoyed his meal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从他愉快的样子来看﹐他这顿饭肯定吃得很开心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Judging from what you say in your letter, you don’t sound well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据你来信中所写的情况来看﹐你好像不大好。

Sense.DEF: to decide on the result of a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had the difficult task of judging the competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我身负担任这次比赛裁判的艰巨任务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Competitors will be judged on speed and accuracy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将根据速度和准确性来对参赛者进行评判。

Sense.DEF: to form an opinion about someone, especially in an unfair or criticizing way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指以不公正或批评的方式〕(对…)作出评价
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just accepts people for what they are and he doesn’t judge them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别人是怎样就怎样﹐他不作评论。

Sense.DEF: to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime in court

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s not for sb to judge
Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not think someone has the right to give their opinion about something
Sense.TRAN: 轮不到某人来评判〔用于表示某人没有权利对某事发表意见〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was it the right decision? It’s not for us to judge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个决定是否正确？这轮不到我们来评论。

Sense.LEXUNIT: as far as I can judge
Sense.DEF: used to say that you think what you are saying is true, but you are not sure
Sense.TRAN: 据我判断〔用于表示相信自己说得没错﹐但没有十足把握〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: don’t judge a book by its cover
Sense.DEF: used to say that you should not form an opinion based only on the way something looks
Sense.TRAN: 勿只凭外表判断﹔勿以貌取人

Sense.DEF: an opinion that you form, especially after thinking carefully about something
Sense.TRAN: 〔认真思考后的〕意见﹐看法﹐评价
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s too soon to make a judgment about what the outcome will be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在就判断结果会怎样还为时过早。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In my judgment, we should accept his offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依我看﹐我们应该接受他的报价。

GramExa.GLOSS: give your opinion, especially a negative one
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our aim is to help him, not to pass judgment on what he has done.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目的是要帮助他﹐而不是对他做的事说三道四。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d advise you to reserve judgmentnot decide your opinion before you have all the facts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我建议你暂时不要表态。

GramExa.GLOSS: even though you do not think it is a sensible thing to do
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I lent him the money, against my better judgment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我觉得不妥﹐但还是把钱借给了他。

Sense.DEF: the ability to make sensible decisions about what to do and when to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve known him for years and I trust his judgment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我与他相识多年﹐相信他的判断力。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 专业上/个人等的判断力
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The minister showed a lack of political judgment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位大臣显得缺乏政治判断力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a decision based on sound judgmentgood judgment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以良好的判断力为基础的决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: Watch carefully and use your judgment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仔细观察并运用自己的判断力。

Sense.DEF: an official decision given by a judge or a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company were fined £6 million, following a recent court judgment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据最近作出的法庭判决﹐这家公司被罚款 600 万英镑。

Sense.DEF: something bad that happens to someone and seems like a punishment for the things they have done wrong
a decision you have to make yourself because there are no fixed rules in a situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔指由于没有既定规章可循而作出的〕自行决定

Sense.DEF: criticizing people very quickly – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 动辄批评人的﹐爱品头论足的〔含贬义〕

Head.GRAMTRAN: 单数, not with ‘the’ 不与 the 连用

Sense.DEF: the last day of the world when all people will be judged by God for what they have done, according to Christianity and some other religions
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教等宗教认为上帝对人类行为进行审判的〕最后审判日﹔世界末日

Sense.DEF: judges as a group, and the organization, power etc of the law
relating to the law, judges, or their decisions
Sense.TRAN: 法律的﹔法官的﹔裁决的﹔司法的

Sense.DEF: all the judges in a country who, as a group, form part of the system of government
done in a sensible and careful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a judicious choice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 审慎而明智的选择

Sense.DEF: a Japanese sport or method of defence, in which you try to throw your opponent onto the ground
a container with a wide curved opening at the top and a handle, used especially at meals for pouring liquids
Sense.EXAMPLE: a milk jug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛奶罐

Sense.DEF: a deep round container with a very narrow opening at the top and a handle, used for holding liquids
the amount of liquid that a jug will hold

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a jug of water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一壶水

Sense.DEF: a woman’s breasts

PIC.HEADING: JUG 壶﹐罐
PIC.PICCONTENT: jug BrE【英】/picher AmE【美】罐；decanter 酒瓶；carafe 喇叭口玻璃瓶

Sense.DEF: a very large vehicle that carries goods over long distances
a very powerful force, organization etc whose effect or influence cannot be stopped
Sense.TRAN: 不可抗拒的强大力量﹔无法控制的强大机构
Sense.EXAMPLE: the juggernaut of industrialization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可抗拒的工业化趋势

Sense.DEF: to keep three or more objects moving through the air by throwing and catching them very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 玩杂耍﹐边抛边接〔数件物品〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One guy was juggling with five balls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个家伙在玩杂耍抛接五个球。

Sense.DEF: to try to fit two or more jobs, activities etc into your life, especially with difficulty
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指吃力地〕同时应付〔几份工作﹑多项活动等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard trying to juggle a job with kids and the housework.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 既要上班﹐又要带孩子﹑做家务﹐是很难应付过来的。

Sense.DEF: to change things or arrange them in the way you want, or in a way that makes it possible for you to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If I juggle these appointments around, I can fit you in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把这些预约调整一下﹐就能把你安排进去。

Sense.DEF: someone who juggles objects in the air, especially to entertain people
Sense.TRAN: 玩杂耍的人﹐杂耍表演者

Sense.DEF: the skill of keeping three or more objects moving through the air by throwing and catching them
Sense.TRAN: 杂耍﹐手技杂耍〔指同时抛接数件物品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a display of juggling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂耍表演

Sense.DEF: the practice of changing things or arranging them in a way that makes it possible for you to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took a lot of juggling and rearrangement of figures before the loan was approved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔贷款获批之前﹐数额曾经多次改动和调整。

Sense.DEF: when someone who has a good job in a profession they have trained for is also secretly involved in an illegal activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔拥有好职位的专业人员所涉及的〕欺骗﹐欺诈

Sense.DEF: the large vein in your neck that takes blood from your head back to your heart
to criticize or attack someone very strongly, especially in order to harm them
Sense.TRAN: 抨击致命弱点﹐攻击要害

Sense.DEF: the liquid that comes from fruit and vegetables, or a drink that is made from this
Sense.TRAN: 〔水果和蔬菜的〕汁﹔水果[蔬菜]汁饮料
Sense.EXAMPLE: a carton of orange juice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一纸盒橙汁
Sense.EXAMPLE: A Coke and a tomato juice, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请来一杯可乐和一杯番茄汁。

Sense.DEF: the liquid that comes out of meat when it is cooked
the liquid inside your stomach that helps you to digest food
something that produces power, such as petrol or electricity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Okay, turn on the juice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好﹐打开电源。

Sense.DEF: to get the juice out of fruit or vegetables
to make something more interesting or exciting
a sort of café that serves drinks made from freshly pressed fruit
Sense.TRAN: 果汁吧〔一种出售鲜榨果汁的小店〕

Sense.DEF: excited
drunk
a kitchen tool used for getting juice out of fruit
containing a lot of juice
Sense.EXAMPLE: a juicy lemon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多汁的柠檬

Sense.DEF: interesting or shocking information, especially about people’s sexual behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤与性行为有关的〕绘声绘色[耸人听闻]的流言/细节/描述等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Want to hear a juicy bit of news?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想不想听点刺激的新闻？

Sense.DEF: involving work that is enjoyable and satisfying
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been trying to get a really juicy role for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年来她一直在寻觅真正让自己满意的角色。

Sense.DEF: involving a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: a big juicy cheque
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张巨额支票

Sense.DEF: a type of fighting from Japan, in which you hold, throw, and hit your opponent
a machine in bars, restaurants etc that plays music when you put money in it
Sense.TRAN: 酒吧﹑餐馆等的投币式〕自动点唱机

Sense.DEF: the seventh month of the year, between June and August

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Laura came over to England last July.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年7月劳拉来到英格兰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I plan to graduate in July.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我计划在7月份毕业。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two months later, on July 6th, he fired Owens.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个月之后﹐在7月6日﹐他把欧文斯辞退了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘When’s the concert?’ ‘On 6th July.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “音乐会是什么时候？” “7月 6日。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The competition ends July 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛于 7 月 6 日结束。

Sense.DEF: a lot of different things mixed together in an untidy way, without any order
Sense.TRAN: 混乱的一团﹐杂乱的一堆

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a jumble of old toys
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堆杂乱的旧玩具
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Inside, she was a jumble of emotions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她心中百感交集。

Sense.DEF: things to be sold at a jumble sale
to mix things together in an untidy way, without any order
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photographs were all jumbled up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照片乱七八糟地堆在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben’s words became jumbled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本开始语无伦次起来。

Sense.DEF: a sale of used clothes, books etc in order to get money for a local church, school etc
Sense.TRAN: 旧杂货的义卖〔以捐助本地教会﹑学校等〕

Sense.DEF: larger than other things of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: jumbo-sized hot dogs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨无霸热狗

Sense.DEF: a very large plane for carrying passengers

Subsense.DEF: to push yourself up into the air, or over or away from something etc, using your legs
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How high can you jump?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能跳多高？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He jumped over the wall and ran off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跳过墙逃走了。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Fans were jumping up and downjumping repeatedly and cheering.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷们不住地蹦跳欢呼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We managed to jump clear of the car before it hit the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在汽车撞上墙之前﹐我们设法从车里跳了出去。

Subsense.DEF: to go over or across something by jumping
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He jumped the gate, landing on the concrete.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跳过大门﹐落到了水泥地上。

Sense.DEF: to let yourself drop from a place that is above the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cats jumped down and came to meet us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些猫跳下来﹐过来迎接我们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Three people saved themselves by jumping from the window.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三人从窗户跳下﹐捡回了性命。

Sense.DEF: to move quickly or suddenly in a particular direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Matt jumped up to answer the phone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马特跳起来去接电话。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We all jumped in a taxi.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都跳上了一辆出租车。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She jumped to her feet and left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她猛地站起来走了。

Sense.DEF: to make a quick sudden movement because you are surprised or frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marcia jumped. ‘What’s that noise?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马西娅吓了一跳。“那是什么声音？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I didn’t mean to make you jumpsurprise or frighten you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我不是有意吓你一跳的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t shout. I nearly jumped out of my skinwas very shocked or frightened!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别叫。我差点吓得跳起来！

Sense.DEF: to increase or improve suddenly and by a large amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Profits jumped to £2.6 million last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年利润猛增至 260 万英镑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Norway jumped from ninth to third place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 挪威从第九位跃升至第三位。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that an amount, level, price etc ‘jumps up’. Say that it jumps. 不要说某一数量﹑水平﹑程度﹑价格等jump(s) up﹐而要说 jump(s)。

Sense.DEF: to change quickly and often from one idea, place, position etc to another – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔经常〕突然改变﹐不断转换〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cathy kept jumping from one topic to another.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯茜老是从一个话题突然转到另一个话题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been jumping about the file instead of working straight through it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我随意翻看了这份文件﹐没有从头看到尾。

Sense.DEF: to move suddenly to a further part of a book, discussion etc leaving out the part in between
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid I jumped a couple of chapters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕我跳过了几章。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The movie suddenly jumped ahead to the future.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片情节一下子跳到了未来。

Sense.DEF: if a machine or piece of equipment jumps, it moves suddenly because something is wrong with it
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器或设备因故障而〕突然跳动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why does the video keep jumping like this?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这录像为什么老是这样跳片？

Sense.DEF: to attack someone suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somebody jumped him in the park last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他昨天晚上在公园里遭人袭击。

Sense.DEF: to form an opinion about something before you have all the facts
Sense.TRAN: 〔在掌握全部事实之前〕仓促下结论
Sense.EXAMPLE: There may be a simple explanation. Let’s not jump to conclusions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许理由很简单﹐我们还是不要仓促下结论。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something too soon, especially without thinking about it carefully
Sense.TRAN: 〔没有认真考虑而〕过早地行动

Sense.DEF: to be extremely happy and pleased
to suddenly speak angrily to someone
to go in front of others who are already waiting in a line – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 插队﹐不按秩序排队〔含贬义〕
