Sense.DEF: to do a series of things that are difficult or annoying, but that are necessary in order to achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 〔为达到目的而〕作出很大努力﹐经受磨难
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to jump through hoops to get our visas in time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了及时获得签证﹐我们只得下一番苦功。

Subsense.DEF: to leave an organization that you are working for, especially in order to join another
Subsense.TRAN: 跳槽﹐离职〔尤指为加入其他机构〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The best employees jumped ship at the first opportunity.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最优秀的员工一有机会就跳槽了。

Subsense.DEF: to leave a ship on which you are working as a sailor, without permission

Sense.DEF: to leave a town, city, or country where a court of law has ordered you to stay until your trial11
used to order someone to do something immediately
Sense.TRAN: 赶快！〔命令某人立即做某事〕

Sense.DEF: used to rudely tell someone to go away
Sense.TRAN: 滚开！〔粗鲁地叫某人离开〕

Sense.DEF: if a train jumps the rails, it suddenly goes off the metal tracks it is moving along
to drive through red traffic lights without stopping
to travel on a train, especially a freight train, without paying
if a television series jumps the shark, something silly happens in it and from that time people stop thinking it is good
Sense.TRAN: 〔某电视连续剧〕突然失去吸引力﹐从此变糟

Sense.DEF: to jump-start a car
to have sex with someone

PIC.HEADING: JUMP 跳
PIC.PICCONTENT: hop 单腿跳；jump 跳；skip BrE【英】/jump rope AmE【美】跳绳；bounce 蹦跳；leap 跳跃

Exponent.DEF: to push yourself up into the air, over something etc, using your legs
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cat jumped up onto the table.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫跳到桌子上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He jumped over the stream.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跃过小溪。

Exponent.DEF: to move forwards with little jumps between your steps, especially because you are feeling happy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The little girl was skipping down the street.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那小女孩蹦蹦跳跳地走在街上。

Exponent.DEF: to jump or move around on one leg
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was hopping around because he’d injured his foot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他弄伤了脚﹐只得单脚跳着走。

Exponent.DEF: especially written to suddenly jump up high or a long way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The deer leapt over the fence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这头鹿跃过了栅栏。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tina leapt onto the boat as it was moving away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船正在驶离时蒂娜跳了上去。

Exponent.DEF: to jump up and down several times, especially on something that has springs in it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Children love bouncing on beds.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子喜欢在床上蹦跳。

Exponent.DEF: to jump into water with your head and arms first
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Zoë dived into the swimming pool.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 佐薇一头扎进了泳池。

Exponent.DEF: to jump over something in one movement, using your hands or a pole to help you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He vaulted the ticket barrier and ran for the exit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跃过检票栏杆﹐朝出口处跑去。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ben tried to vault over the bar.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本想要跃过栏杆。

Sense.DEF: to eagerly accept the chance to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I jumped at the chance of a trip to Hong Kong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我迫不及待接受了去香港的机会。

Sense.DEF: to interrupt someone or suddenly join a conversation
Sense.TRAN: 打断某人的话﹔突然插话
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lena quickly jumped in with a diverting remark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉娜赶紧插了一句打趣的话。

Sense.DEF: to criticize or punish someone, especially unfairly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He used to jump on me for every little mistake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前我一有点小错他就要大加斥责。

Sense.DEF: if something jumps out at you, it is extremely noticeable, often in a way you do not like
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人〕一眼就看得出来﹐极易引起〔某人〕注意
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t like jewellery that jumps out at you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢那种招摇的珠宝首饰。

Sense.DEF: an act of pushing yourself suddenly up into the air using your legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: the best jump of the competition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次比赛中的最佳一跳
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dancer famous for his impressive jumps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位以其出色的跳跃闻名的舞蹈家

Sense.DEF: an act of letting yourself drop from a place that is above the ground

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Douglas made his first 10,000-foot parachute jump yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天道格拉斯进行了他的首次一万英尺跳伞。

Sense.DEF: a sudden large increase in an amount or value

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a jump in inflation rates
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀率的飙升

Sense.DEF: a large or sudden change, especially one that improves things
Sense.TRAN: 巨大[突然]的变化〔尤指改善〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new law is a great jump forward for human rights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部新法律是人权领域的一大进步。

Sense.DEF: if you wake, sit up etc with a jump, you do it very suddenly because you are surprised or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 〔因感到意外或吃惊而〕突然﹐猛然
Sense.EXAMPLE: She woke with a jump, hearing a noise downstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听到楼下有声音﹐一下子醒了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep/stay etc a jump ahead (of sb)
Sense.DEF: to keep your advantage over the people you are competing with by always being the first to do or know something new
Sense.TRAN: 〔因先行动或先知道而〕保持(对竞争对手的)领先优势

Sense.DEF: a fence, gate, or wall that a person or horse has to jump over in a race or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her horse cleared all the jumps in the first round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的马在第一轮比赛中跃过了所有的障碍物。

Sense.DEF: to gain an advantage, especially by doing something earlier than usual or earlier than someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因先做而〕取得对某人/某事的优势
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to get a jump on my Christmas shopping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想提早一步开始圣诞节购物。

Sense.DEF: the act of throwing the ball up in a game of basketball, so that one player from each team can try to gain control of it
a jumped-up person thinks they are more important than they really are, because they have improved their social position
Sense.TRAN: 〔因社会地位提升而〕自命不凡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jumped-up little bureaucrat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个自大的小官僚

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing made of wool that covers the upper part of your body and arms
a dress without sleeves usually worn over a shirt
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常穿在衬衣外面的〕无袖连衣裙

Sense.DEF: a person or animal that jumps
thick wires used to connect the batteries (battery) of two cars in order to start the car that has lost power
Sense.TRAN: 跨接线﹐跳接线〔用于连接两辆汽车的电池以发动其中没电的一辆〕

Sense.DEF: a jump that is done from a standing position with your arms and legs pointing out to the side
Sense.TRAN: 跳跃运动〔两腿分开﹑两臂侧向伸展的原地跳跃〕

Sense.DEF: a place to start from, especially at the beginning of a journey
an aircraft that can take off and land by going straight up and down
thick wires used to connect the batteries (battery) of two cars in order to start the car that has lost power
Sense.TRAN: 跨接线﹐跳接线〔用于连接两辆汽车的电池以发动其中没电的一辆〕

Sense.DEF: a long piece of rope that children use for jumping over
an action in basketball in which you throw the ball towards the basket as you jump in the air
to start a car whose battery has lost power by connecting it to the battery of another car
to help a process or activity to start or become more successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congress hopes the tax cut will jump-start the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会希望减税能够推动经济发展。

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing like a shirt and a pair of trousers joined together, worn especially by women
a type of popular music from the Caribbean with a strong regular beat, or a party, event etc where this music is played
Sense.TRAN: 〔加勒比地区的〕蹦跳音乐﹔蹦跳舞派对﹔蹦跳乐音乐会

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: young people who like this type of music

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜欢蹦跳音乐的青少年

Sense.DEF: worried or nervous, especially because you are expecting something bad to happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因预计将发生不祥之事而〕提心吊胆的﹐紧张不安的
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= June 六月

Sense.DEF: a place where one road, track etc joins another
Sense.TRAN: 〔公路﹑铁路等的〕连接点﹐汇合处﹐交叉口
Sense.EXAMPLE: the junction of Abbot Road and Mill Street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿伯特路与米尔街的交叉口
Sense.EXAMPLE: Junction 5 on the M40
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 40号高速公路上的第5交叉口

Sense.DEF: a particular point in an activity or period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Atthis juncture, I suggest we take a short break.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此时此刻﹐我建议大家稍事休息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The talks are at a critical juncturevery important point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会谈正处于紧急关头。

Sense.DEF: the sixth month of the year, between May and July

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I finished school last June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去年6月毕业的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My birthday is in June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的生日在6月份。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We met on June 6th.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在6月6日相遇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He resigned on 6th June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他6月6日那天辞职了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first round will be held June 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一回合将于6月6日举行。

Sense.DEF: a thick tropical forest with many large plants growing very close together
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Amazon jungle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚马孙丛林

Sense.DEF: a situation in which it is difficult to become successful or get what you want, especially because a lot of people are competing with each other
Sense.TRAN: 竞争激烈的情形〔尤因竞争者众多〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the media jungle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弱肉强食的传媒界

Sense.DEF: something that is very untidy, complicated, or confusing
Sense.TRAN: 杂乱无章的一堆﹐乱七八糟的一丛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a jungle of freeways and highways
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂乱交错的高速公路和公路

Sense.DEF: a type of very fast dance music
Sense.TRAN: 丛林音乐〔一种快速舞蹈音乐〕

Sense.DEF: a large frame made of metal bars for children to climb on
used after the name of a man or boy who has the same name as his father
Sense.TRAN: 小〔置于与父亲同名的男子或男孩姓名之后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: John F. Kennedy, Jr.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小约翰·F. 肯尼迪

Sense.DEF: having a low rank in an organization or profession
Sense.TRAN: 〔在组织或行业中〕级别低的﹐职位低的﹐初级的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a junior doctor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 初级医生

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are several people junior to me with a lower rank than me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个人级别比我低。

Sense.DEF: relating to sport for young people below a particular age
Sense.EXAMPLE: the junior football club
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年足球俱乐部

Sense.DEF: relating to a school for children below the age of 11
Sense.TRAN: 低年级的〔学校里低于 11 岁的学童〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the junior classrooms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低年级教室

Sense.DEF: relating to the year before the final year of high school or college
Sense.TRAN: 〔高中或四年制大学〕三年级(学生)的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the second semester of my junior year
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我三年级的第二个学期

Sense.LEXUNIT: be two/five/ten etc years sb’s junior

Variant.LEXVAR: be sb’s junior by two/five/ten etc years

Sense.DEF: written to be two, five, ten etc years younger than someone
Sense.TRAN: 比某人小两岁/五岁/十岁等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She married a man seven years her junior.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嫁给了一个比她小七岁的男人。

Sense.DEF: a young person who takes part in sport for people below a particular age
Sense.EXAMPLE: The juniors use the courts on Tuesday night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年运动员在星期二晚上使用这些球场。

Sense.DEF: someone who has a low rank in an organization or profession
Sense.EXAMPLE: an office junior
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室低级职员

Sense.DEF: a child who goes to a junior school
a student in the year before the final year of high school or college
Sense.TRAN: 〔高中或四年制大学的〕三年级学生

Sense.DEF: a name used humorously when speaking to or about a boy or a younger man, especially your son
Sense.TRAN: 男孩﹔年轻男子﹔〔尤指〕儿子〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where’s Junior?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿子在哪儿？

Sense.DEF: a college in the US or Canada where students take a course of study that continues for two years
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国或加拿大的〕两年制专科学校﹐大专

Sense.DEF: a school in the US and Canada for children aged between 12 and 14 or 15
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国或加拿大 12 至 14 或 15 岁孩子上的〕初级中学

Sense.DEF: a school in Britain for children aged 7 to 11
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国 7 至 11 岁孩子上的〕小学

Sense.DEF: a team of younger or less experienced sports players who represent a school or university
Sense.TRAN: 〔由学校中年龄较小或经验较浅的运动员组成的〕二队﹐乙队

Sense.DEF: a small bush that produces purple berries that can be used in cooking
old or unwanted objects that have no use or value
Sense.EXAMPLE: This cupboard’s full of junk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个壁橱里塞满了杂物。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use junk when you are talking about things such as empty packets, cans, and bottles that are left in a public place. Use litter. 不要用 junk 指人们丢弃在公共场所的空纸盒﹑空罐头和空瓶子﹐而要用litter: Don’t drop litter in the street. 别在街上乱丢垃圾。

Sense.DEF: a Chinese sailing boat
to get rid of something because it is old or useless
a bond which has a high risk and is often sold to pay for a takeover
Sense.TRAN: 低档债券﹐风险债券﹐垃圾债券

Sense.DEF: an expensive trip paid for by government money or by a business for people they employ - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔由政府或企业为其雇员出资的昂贵的〕公费旅游〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: food that is not healthy, for example because it contains a lot of fat, sugar etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔高脂肪﹑高糖分等的〕不利健康的食品﹐垃圾食品

Sense.DEF: someone who takes dangerous drugs and is dependent on them
Sense.TRAN: 吸毒成瘾者﹐有毒瘾者﹐瘾君子

Sense.DEF: someone who likes something so much that they seem to be dependent on it – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 电视迷/体育迷等〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a technology junkie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科技迷

Sense.DEF: letters, especially advertisements, that are sent by organizations to large numbers of people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 垃圾(广告)邮件﹐(邮寄的)广告宣传品〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a shop that buys and sells old furniture, clothes etc
another spelling of junkie
a place where old or broken furniture, cars etc can be left, or bought and sold
a military government that has gained power by using force
the planet that is fifth in order from the sun and is the largest in the solar system
Sense.TRAN: 木星〔太阳系中最大的行星〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a space probe on its way to Jupiter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞向木星的一个太空探测器

Sense.DEF: belonging or relating to the period of time from about 210 million years ago to about 140 million years ago, when there were dinosaurs and the first mammals and birds
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Jurassic period
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侏罗纪

Sense.DEF: relating to judges or the law
the right to use an official power to make legal decisions, or the area where this right exists
Sense.TRAN: 司法权﹔审判权﹔管辖权﹔管辖区域

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee has jurisdiction over all tax measures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个委员会有权制定所有税收措施。

Sense.DEF: the science or study of law
someone who has a very detailed knowledge of law
a member of a jury
a group of 12 ordinary people who listen to the details of a case in court and decide whether someone is guilty or not
Sense.TRAN: 〔由 12 名公民组成的〕陪审团
Sense.EXAMPLE: the members of the jury
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团成员
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury found him not guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团裁定他无罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the right to trial by jury
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由陪审团进行审理的权利

Sense.DEF: a group of people chosen to judge a competition

Sense.LEXUNIT: the jury is (still) out on sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that something has not been finally decided
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it good value? The jury is still out on that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样合算吗？现在还不好说。

Sense.DEF: the place where the jury sits in a court
a period of time during which you must be part of a jury
a thin sauce for meat or fish
Sense.EXAMPLE: lamb served with a red wine jus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配红酒酱汁的羊羔肉

Sense.DEF: exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good strong cup of coffee is just what I need right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在正需要喝一杯浓浓的咖啡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was large and roomy; just right for us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢房子大而宽敞﹐正合我们的需要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looks just like her mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去就像她妈妈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just what do you think you’re trying to do?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你究竟想干什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s just on three o’clock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在正好三点钟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just thenexactly at that moment, Mrs Robovitch appeared at the bedroom door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在那时﹐罗博维奇太太出现在卧室门口。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just asat the exact moment when I opened the door, the telephone started to ring.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在我开门时﹐电话铃响了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A nice hot bath – just the thingexactly the right thing to relax sore muscles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗个舒服的热水澡﹐那正是缓解肌肉酸痛的好方法。

Sense.DEF: nothing more than the thing, amount, action etc that you are mentioning
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s nothing serious – just a small cut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要紧﹐只不过是个小伤口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be too hard on himhe’s just a kid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要对他太苛刻﹐他只是个小孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you wait just a few minutes?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就等几分钟好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not just me – there are other people involved as well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不光是我﹐还有其他人也参加了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use simply rather than just, which sounds rather informal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们常常喜欢用 simply﹐而不用 just﹐因为后者听起来相当不正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It’s simply a question of priorities.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是一个轻重缓急的问题。

Sense.DEF: only a short time ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: John’s just told me that he’s getting married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰刚刚告诉我他要结婚了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve just been out shopping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚才出去买东西了。

Sense.DEF: at this moment or at that moment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait a minute, I’m just coming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一下﹐我这就来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was just leaving when the phone rang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正准备离开时﹐电话铃响了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just finishing my homework – it won’t take long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在做家庭作业﹐马上就好了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concert was just about to start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会马上就要开始了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: It just isn’t true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这根本不是真的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just love being in the mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确实很喜欢待在山区。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was just wonderful to see Joyce again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能够再见到乔伊斯真是太好了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just wish I could believe you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真希望我能够相信你。

Sense.DEF: only by a small amount, time, distance etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔数量﹑时间﹑距离等〕就﹐只〔相差一点点〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We moved here just after our son was born.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿子出生后我们就搬到这儿来了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I saw her just before she died.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在她去世前我还见过她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just under three centimetres long.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它的长度将近三厘米。

Sense.DEF: used to show that something which happens almost does not happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just managed to get home before dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚好赶在天黑前到家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could just see the coast of France in the distance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们勉强能够看到远处的法国海岸线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those pants only just fit you now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条裤子你现在穿勉强合身。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was earning just enough money to live on enough but not more than enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挣的钱刚够维持生活。

Sense.DEF: almost
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plums are just about ripe now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下李子都快熟了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just about everybody will be affected by the tax increases.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎每个人都将受到加税的影响。

Sense.DEF: equally as good, bad, big etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brad is just as good as the others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉德和其他人一样好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love this country just as much as you do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和你一样热爱这个国家。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has to do something because nothing else is possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll just have to watch and see what happens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只好静观事态的发展。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You just have to accept things and get on with your life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只能接受事实﹐继续过日子。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are talking about a particular thing or person that is especially good or important
Sense.TRAN: 不是随便哪一种〔强调所提到的是特别好或重要的事物或人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the best results, use olive oil. Not just any olive oil, mind – only the finest quality will do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要获得最佳效果就要使用橄榄油。 注意﹐不是随便哪一种橄榄油都可以﹐只有质量最好的才行。

Sense.DEF: if you would just as soon do something, you would prefer to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d just as soon stay at home – I don’t really enjoy parties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我宁愿留在家里﹐我不大喜欢参加派对。

Sense.DEF: might possibly
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could try Renee. She might just know where they live now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你问勒妮试试看﹐她可能知道他们现在住哪儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It may just have been a coincidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许那只是个巧合。

Sense.DEF: not now, but probably soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t leave just yet. I’ve still got a couple of letters to write.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这会儿还不能走﹐我还有几封信要写。

Sense.DEF: used to say that, although one thing is true, another thing is not necessarily true
Sense.TRAN: 不能因为…就﹐尽管…也不可以
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just because you’re older than me, it doesn’t mean you can tell me what to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能因为你岁数比我大﹐就可以把我呼来喝去。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone to wait for a short time while you do something
Subsense.TRAN: 请稍等〔用于做某事时请别人等一等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Just a minute, I’ll see if I can find it for you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请稍等﹐我来看看能否帮你找到它。

Subsense.DEF: used to interrupt someone in order to ask them something, disagree with them etc
Subsense.TRAN: 且慢〔用于打断别人的话﹐以询问某事或表示不同意等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Just a minute! How do I know you’re not telling me a pack of lies?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 且慢！我怎么知道你对我不是谎话连篇呢？

Subsense.DEF: used when politely asking something or telling someone to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于礼貌地请求某事或请某人做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Could I just say a few words before we start?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始之前﹐我能否说几句话？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Would you just explain to us how the system works.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能否为我们解释一下这个系统是如何运作的？

Subsense.DEF: used when firmly telling someone to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于严厉地命令某人做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Look, just shut up for a minute!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐把你的嘴闭上一会儿！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now, just listen to what I’m telling you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐听好我在跟你讲的话。

Sense.DEF: used when explaining the reason for something, especially when someone thinks there is a different reason
Sense.TRAN: 只是〔用来说明原因﹐尤其在有人认为另有原因时使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, I do like Chinese food, it’s just that I’m not hungry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐我确实很喜欢中国菜﹐只是我不饿。

Subsense.DEF: a very short time ago
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Where have my glasses gone? I had them just now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的眼镜哪里去了？ 我刚才还戴着呢。

Subsense.DEF: at this moment
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’re busy just now – can you come back later?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在很忙﹐你过一会儿再来好吗？

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to imagine or look at the same thing that you are imagining or looking at
Sense.TRAN: 且想想/想象一下/且看看
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just think – in a week we’ll be lying on a beach in the sun!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想想吧﹐一星期后我们就躺在沙滩上晒太阳了！

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is fortunate that something is true or happened because otherwise there would be problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just as well we’d prepared everything beforehand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸亏我们事先把一切都准备好了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: isn’t she just/aren’t they just etc
Sense.DEF: used to strongly agree with something someone has said about a person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 没错﹐的确〔对某人的话表示强烈赞同〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s a selfish, rude, ignorant man!’ ‘Isn’t he just!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个自私﹑粗鲁又无知的家伙！” “可不是嘛！”

Subsense.DEF: with everything arranged neatly and tidily
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her house always has to be just so.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的房子总是井井有条的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say yes or agree with something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘You should have beaten them, shouldn’t you?’ ‘Just so.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你本来应该赢他们的﹐是不是？” “就是嘛。”

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the adverb just in spoken and written English. 副词 just 在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

This graph shows that the adverb just is much more common in spoken English than in written English. This is because it has special uses in spoken English and is used in a lot of common spoken phrases. 本图表显示﹐副词 just 在英语口语中的使用频率远高于书面语中﹐这是因为它在英语口语中有特殊用法﹐并出现在许多常用口语短语中。

Sense.DEF: morally right and fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry sincerely believed that he was fighting a just war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利真心地相信他在打一场正义的战争。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a just settlement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公平的协议
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charlemagne was respected as a just ruler.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查理曼作为一位公正的统治者﹐受到大家敬重。

Sense.DEF: deserved by someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a just reward for their loyal service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们忠诚服务所应得的奖励
Sense.EXAMPLE: What would be a just punishment for such a crime?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的罪行该如何惩罚？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope that he’s caught and gets his just desertsis punished in the way he deserves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他被抓住并受到应有的惩罚。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: These men are criminals, but they must be dealt with justly.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人是罪犯﹐但也必须受到公正的处置。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: an achievement of which we can be justly proud
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有理由引以为傲的一项成就

Sense.DEF: the system by which people are judged in courts of law and criminals are punished
Sense.TRAN: 司法制度﹔审判﹔法律制裁
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book on the criminal justice system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本有关刑事审判制度的书
Sense.EXAMPLE: The killers will be brought to justicecaught and punished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些杀人犯将被绳之以法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Acts of terrorism must not escape justice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖主义行为必定难逃法律制裁。

Sense.DEF: fairness in the way people are treated
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children have a strong sense of justice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童有很强的正义感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His people came to him demanding justice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手下来找他﹐寻求公正。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being right and deserving fair treatment
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one doubts the justice of our cause.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人怀疑我们的事业是正义的。

Sense.DEF: to treat or represent someone or something good, beautiful etc in a way that is as good as they deserve
Sense.TRAN: 公平对待某人/某物﹔充分展现某人/某物的最佳素质
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photo doesn’t do her justice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张照片没有把她拍好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No words can do justice to the experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无法用言语来描述此次经历。

Sense.DEF: to do something such as a test well enough to show your real ability
Sense.TRAN: 〔在考试等中〕充分发挥(自己的能力)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sara panicked in the exam and didn’t do herself justice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉考试时惊慌失措﹐未能充分发挥自己的水平。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has been treated fairly or has been given a punishment they deserve

Subsense.DEF: a judge in a law court
the title of a judge in the High Court

Sense.DEF: someone who judges less serious cases in small law courts and, in the US, can perform marriage ceremonies
Sense.TRAN: 治安法官﹐太平绅士〔在美国还有证婚权〕

Sense.DEF: actions, reactions, decisions etc that are justifiable are acceptable because they are done for good reasons
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑反应﹑决定等〕有道理的﹐可证明是正当的﹐情有可原的
Sense.EXAMPLE: justifiable anger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情有可原的愤怒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are these experiments morally justifiable?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些实验合乎道德准则吗？

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you are not punished for killing someone, usu­ally because you did it to defend yourself
Sense.TRAN: 正当杀人〔一般指因自卫而杀人﹐因此不受惩罚〕

Sense.DEF: a good and acceptable reason for doing something
Sense.TRAN: 正当的理由﹐可接受的理由

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no justification for holding her in jail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有理由羁押她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Hoggart felt, with some justification, that his colleagues had let him down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍加特觉得同事令他失望﹐这是有理由的。

Sense.DEF: in order to explain why an idea or action is right
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a speech in justification of his actions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发表了一段讲话来为自己的行为辩解。

Sense.DEF: having an acceptable explanation or reason
Sense.TRAN: 有合理解释的﹐有正当理由的
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the Chief Constable’s view, the use of force was fully justified.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在警察局局长看来﹐使用武力是完全正当的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Under the circumstances, the principal was justified in expelling this student.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这种情况下﹐校长完全有理由开除这名学生。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a page where the words form a straight edge on the right or left side of the page
to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable
Sense.TRAN: 证明〔别人认为不合理的事〕有道理﹔为…辩护
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can we justify spending so much money on arms?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们怎么才能解释花那么多钱购买武器是正当的呢？

GramExa.GLOSS: prove that what you are doing is reasonable
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t have to justify myself to you or anyone else.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不需要为我的行为向你或任何人解释。

Sense.DEF: to be a good and acceptable reason for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing justifies murdering another human being.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么都不能成为谋杀他人的正当理由。

Sense.DEF: to arrange lines of words on a page or computer screen so that they form a straight edge on both the right and left sides
if goods are produced or bought using a just-in-time system, they are produced or bought just before they are needed so that the company does not have to store things for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 适时(制)的〔产品在需要时才生产或购买﹐以免长时间储存〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: just-in-time manufacturing methods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适时生产法

Sense.DEF: something that juts out sticks out further than the other things around it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tall jagged rocks jutted out over the beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高耸嶙峋的岩石突兀于海滩之上。

Sense.DEF: if you jut your chin out, you move it so that it sticks forward
Sense.EXAMPLE: She jutted her chin out aggressively as she glowered back at him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挑衅地抬起下巴﹐对他还以愤怒的目光。

Sense.DEF: a natural substance that is used for making rope and rough cloth
law relating to young people who are not yet adults
Sense.EXAMPLE: juvenile crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少年犯罪
Sense.EXAMPLE: a juvenile court
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少年法院[法庭]

Sense.DEF: silly and typical of a child rather than an adult – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 幼稚的﹐年幼无知的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very juvenile sense of humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很幼稚的幽默感

Sense.DEF: juvenile birds or animals are young
a child or young person who behaves in a criminal way
to put things together, especially things that are not normally together, in order to compare them or to make something new
Sense.TRAN: 把…并列[并置]〔以作比较或制作新东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a style of decor that juxtaposes antiques with modern furniture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 古董和现代家具混搭的装饰风格
